Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Authenticity \Au`then*tic"i*ty\, n. [Cf. F. authenticit['e].] 1. The quality of being authentic or of established authority for truth and correctness. [1913 Webster]
2. Genuineness; the quality of being genuine or not corrupted from the original. [1913 Webster]
Note: In later writers, especially those on the evidences of Christianity, authenticity is often restricted in its use to the first of the above meanings, and distinguished from qenuineness. [1913 Webster]
